page.title: 14Principal physical features
page.content: The areas of Winster, Birchover and Stanton are situated in moorland and some woodland which is part of the Southernmost tip of the Pennines. General altitude is 750 - 1000. It is an area of gritstone and limestone outcrops interdispersed with crystaline mineral deposits. There are many quarries in the gritstone areas and the limestone area is littered with mineshafts sunk principally for lead. At one time Enthovens was one of the largest lead mines in Western Europe. Birchover and Winster are small very old settlements nesting in the lee of hillsides. The area's natural beauty and its location in the Peak National Park throughout the year ensure a steady stream of tourists and people seeking outdoor pursuits.
